verses.text: 我兒，不可忘記我的訓誨，你的心要謹守我的誡命；

words.note: To carefully adhere to

verses.text: 因為它們必把長久的日子、生命的歲數和平安，加給你。

words.note: Indicates certainty or necessity
Introduces the object of a verb in a 'ba' construction

words.definition: to add to, to bestow upon

verses.text: 不可讓慈愛誠實離開你，要繫在你的頸項上，刻在你的心版上。

words.note: Often refers to God's steadfast love or mercy
Used as a locative suffix here
Figurative: 'tablet of the heart', referring to the mind or conscience
Used as a locative suffix here

verses.text: 這樣，你在 神和世人眼前，必蒙恩寵，得著美名（「名」原文作「明慧」）。

words.note: The empty space often indicates reverence for God's name.
Lit. 'world's people'

words.definition: before one's eyes, in the presence of

words.note: Indicates certainty or necessity
Often used with blessings, grace, or favor.
A common compound for 'to get/receive'
Lit. 'clear wisdom'

verses.text: 你要一心仰賴耶和華，不可倚靠自己的聰明；

words.note: Lit. 'one heart'

words.definition: to rely on, to trust in
words.note: To look up to and rely on

words.definition: to rely on, to depend on

verses.text: 在你一切所行的路上，都要承認他，他必使你的路徑平坦正直。

words.note: Nominalizes a verb phrase

words.definition: to do, to walk, to act

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity

verses.text: 不可自以為有智慧，要敬畏耶和華，遠離惡事。

words.definition: to consider oneself as, to be conceited

words.note: Often used in religious contexts regarding God

words.definition: to stay away from, to keep far from

verses.text: 這必使你的身體健康，使你的骨頭滋潤。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity

verses.text: 你要把你的財物，和一切初熟的農作物，敬奉耶和華。

words.note: Refers to the first harvest, a biblical concept

words.definition: to make, to do, to grow

words.note: Specifically implies offering to a deity or respected figure

verses.text: 這樣，你的倉庫必充滿有餘，你的榨酒池也必盈溢新酒。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity
Indicates strong certainty or necessity

verses.text: 我兒，不可輕看耶和華的管教，也不可厭惡他的責備；

words.note: A term of endearment or address from an elder/mentor.
Transliteration of Hebrew YHWH.
Implies guidance and instruction, not just punishment.

verses.text: 因為耶和華所愛的，他必責備，正如父親責備他喜愛的兒子一樣。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb that follows.
Combines with '所愛' to mean 'those whom he loves'.

verses.text: 得著智慧，獲致聰明的人，是有福的。

words.note: Often paired with wisdom in biblical contexts.
Lit. 'has blessing'.

verses.heading: Blessings of Obtaining Wisdom

verses.text: 因為智慧的利潤勝過銀子的利潤，智慧的收益勝過黃金的收益。
智慧比紅寶石更寶貴；你一切所喜愛的，都不足與智慧比較。

words.note: Used to form comparative sentences.
A precious stone, often mentioned in biblical literature.
Indicates the object of the verb that follows.
Combines with '一切所喜愛' to mean 'all that you delight in'.

verses.text: 智慧的右手有長壽，左手有財富和尊榮。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine glory/honor.

verses.text: 智慧的道路盡是歡悅，智慧的路徑全是平安。

words.note: A common greeting, also signifies spiritual peace.

verses.text: 對緊握智慧的人來說，智慧是生命樹，凡是緊抓智慧的，都是有福的。

words.note: Used to introduce a perspective or opinion.
Refers to the tree in the Garden of Eden and in Revelation.
Signifies being blessed by God; a common biblical phrase.

verses.text: 耶和華以智慧奠定大地，以聰明堅立高天。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often refers to the dwelling place of God or the highest heavens.

verses.text: 因他的知識，深淵就裂開，天空也滴下甘露。

words.note: Frequently used in biblical contexts to refer to primeval waters or the underworld.

verses.text: 我兒，要謹守大智慧和明辨的態度，不可讓它們離開你的眼目。

words.note: A common term of address in Proverbs from father to son.
Biblically, often refers to divine wisdom.
A more formal or literary term for 'eyes'.

verses.text: 這樣，它們就必作你的生命，作你頸上的華飾。

words.note: In the Bible, often refers to spiritual life or existence.
Refers to something beautiful and valuable worn on the neck.

verses.text: 你就可以安然走路，你的腳必不致絆倒。

words.definition: will not lead to, not cause

verses.text: 你躺下的時候，必不會驚恐；你躺臥的時候，必睡得香甜。

words.note: Slightly more formal or literary than 躺下.
Describes a deep, pleasant sleep.

verses.text: 忽然而來的驚恐，你不要懼怕；惡人的毀滅臨到，你也不要恐懼；

words.note: Refers to those who are morally evil or ungodly.
Implies something happening to or reaching someone.

verses.text: 因為耶和華是你的倚靠，他必護衛你的腳不陷入網羅。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Can also be a verb 'to rely on'.
Often used metaphorically for dangers or temptations.

verses.text: 如果你的手有行善的力量，就不可推辭，要向那些需要幫助的人行善。

words.note: Emphasizes moral or benevolent actions.
Repetition for emphasis, common in biblical texts.

verses.heading: Wisdom Demonstrated in Relationships with People

verses.text: 你那裡如果有現成的，就不可對鄰舍說：「你先回去，明天再來吧，到時，我必給你！」
你的鄰舍在你旁邊安居，你不可設計害他。

words.note: Refers to living in peace and security.
Here implies negative scheming, not 'design'.

verses.text: 如果人沒有加害於你，你不可無故與他相爭。

words.note: Implies intentional harm being inflicted.
A more classical preposition, meaning 'towards' or 'upon'.
Implies reciprocal arguing or striving against.

verses.text: 不要嫉妒強暴的人，也不可選擇他所行的一切道路；

words.note: Indicates the object or agent of the following verb.

verses.text: 因為偏離正道的人，是耶和華所厭惡的，正直人卻是他所親愛的。

words.note: Lit. 'correct way'
The Hebrew name for God.
Indicates the object or agent of the following verb.
Indicates the object or agent of the following verb.

verses.text: 耶和華咒詛惡人的家，卻賜福給義人的居所。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Lit. 'bestow blessing'
More formal than just 'home'.

verses.text: 他譏笑那些好譏笑的人，卻賜恩給謙卑的人。

words.note: Pronounced 'hào' when meaning 'to like'.
Functions as object of '好'.
Lit. 'bestow grace'

verses.text: 智慧人必承受尊榮，愚昧人必蒙受羞辱（「必蒙受羞辱」原文作「高升成為羞辱」）。

words.note: Often used for receiving something undesirable.
Often used for receiving something undesirable.
